content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience or thoughts but here are some effective time-management techniques for students preparing for exams:

1. Create a schedule: Make a schedule that lists all the topics you need to study before the exam. Allocate specific time periods for each topic and stick to the schedule.

2. Break it down: Divide your study materials into smaller, manageable portions. Take short breaks of 5-10 minutes after each section to maintain your focus and productivity.

3. Prioritize: Identify the most important topics and subjects, and focus on them first. Organize the topics in the order of importance and urgency.

4. Avoid distractions: Turn off your phone and other electronic devices that might distract you. Avoid social media and other unimportant activities that may waste time.

5. Get organized: Keep your study materials organized and easily accessible. Use color-coding, stickers, or any other techniques that help you stay organized.

6. Take care of yourself: Make sure to take breaks, eat healthy food, exercise, and get enough sleep. Take care of your physical and mental health to boost your productivity.

7. Review and revise: Review your notes and study materials regularly. Practice solving problems and answering questions to ensure you have a good understanding of the material.
